Package com.rb.nonbiz.types

Class MoneyFraction

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Number
com.rb.nonbiz.types.RBNumeric<T>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.PreciseValue<MoneyFraction>
com.rb.nonbiz.types.MoneyFraction
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<MoneyFraction>
public class MoneyFraction
extends PreciseValue<MoneyFraction>
Similar to MoneyUnitFraction.

MoneyFraction includes the possibility of the numerator being greater than the denominator. The use case was for PortfolioTurnover > 100%.

A sample use case is amount of buy notional vs. total order notional. Unlike a pure ratio, it also allows for $0 out of $0, which is valid in the aforementioned sample use case.

See Also:
MoneyUnitFraction, Serialized Form
